name: shelved

past simple and past participle of
shelve
shelve verb
(DELAY)
[ T ] to not take action on something until a later time: I've had to shelve my plans to buy a new car, because I can't afford it at the moment.

shelve verb
(SHELF)
[ T ] to put something onto shelves, or to fix shelves somewhere

shelve verb
(SLOPE)
[ I ]
  geology
  specialized When a surface such as the bottom of the sea shelves, it slopes down gradually: The sea bed shelves gently for several hundred metres.
